@graph.name: Best Chocolate Cupcakes Recipe - JoyFoodSunshine
@graph.description: With this chocolate cupcake recipe it's easy to make the best chocolate cupcakes that are moist, chocolatey & have the perfect texture.

@graph.name: Can you double this Chocolate Cupcake recipe?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes! You can easily double (or triple) this chocolate cupcake recipe. This is a great option if you want to make enough homemade chocolate cupcakes for a large crowd.

@graph.name: How do you keep cupcakes moist?

acceptedAnswer.text: Make sure to store them in an airtight container at room temperature or in the freezer. Often times putting them in the refrigerator will dry them out.

@graph.name: Best Chocolate Cupcake Recipe
@graph.description: This chocolate cupcake recipe is easy to make from scratch with simple ingredients. They are the best, moist chocolate cupcakes with a rich chocolate flavor and perfect texture.

video.name: Chocolate Cupcake Recipe
video.description: This chocolate cupcake recipe is easy to make from scratch with simple ingredients. They are the best, moist chocolate cupcakes with a rich chocolate flavor and perfect texture.

recipeInstructions.text: Line a standard muffin tin with 12 cups and lightly spray with cooking spray. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Line a standard muffin tin with 12 cups and lightly spray with cooking spray. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium bowl, combine flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder, sea salt and espresso powder. Set aside
recipeInstructions.name: In a medium bowl, combine flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder, sea salt and espresso powder. Set aside

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, whisk together canola oil, eggs, sour cream, milk and vanilla until the mixture is smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, whisk together canola oil, eggs, sour cream, milk and vanilla until the mixture is smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Add dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and whisk until combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Add dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and whisk until combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Add mini chocolate chips and stir until evenly distributed.
recipeInstructions.name: Add mini chocolate chips and stir until evenly distributed.

recipeInstructions.text: Use a ¼ cup measuring cup to fill each cupcake liner with ¼ cup of batter.
recipeInstructions.name: Use a ¼ cup measuring cup to fill each cupcake liner with ¼ cup of batter.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake in the preheated oven for 13-15 minutes, or until the tops are set and a toothpick inserted in the center of the cupcakes comes out clean or with a few crumbs.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake in the preheated oven for 13-15 minutes, or until the tops are set and a toothpick inserted in the center of the cupcakes comes out clean or with a few crumbs.

recipeInstructions.text: Place cupcake pan on a wire cooling rack to cool to room temperature (takes about 30 minutes).
recipeInstructions.name: Place cupcake pan on a wire cooling rack to cool to room temperature (takes about 30 minutes).

recipeInstructions.text: Once cool, lift cupcakes in their liners out of the pan and transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
recipeInstructions.name: Once cool, lift cupcakes in their liners out of the pan and transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.

recipeInstructions.text: Once cool, frost with chocolate frosting and serve.
recipeInstructions.name: Once cool, frost with chocolate frosting and serve.
